Class UniversalPartialWordsGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.UniversalPartialWordsGenerator

  • public class UniversalPartialWordsGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UniversalPartialWordsGenerator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> generateUniversalPartialWords(int k, int n, int i, char universalCharacter)
      Generates list of universal partial words with a universal character at the given index with the given alphabet size and code length First calculates the correct length of the u-p-words and then performs a brute force search finding each unique combination of letters in the alphabet of this length.
      private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> generateUniversalPartialWords(int k, int n, int newLength, int index, char universalCharacter) 
      private static void generateUniversalPartialWords(int k, int n, int wordLength, java.lang.String upword, int index, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> covered, char universalCharacter, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> found)
      Generates list of universal partial words with a universal character at the given index with the given alphabet size and code length Adds any found u-p-words to a list Recursively extends the given u-p-word for each letter in the given alphabet At each step adds any new code found to covered codes list Ends when either the current u-p-word is of the correct length, adding it to the current list if it is correct OR ends when a code is found that already exists in the covered codes list, indicating that this u-p-word is incorrect
      static int getMaxIndex(int k, int n)
      Calculates the maximum length for a universal partial word with given alphabet size and code length This indicates the maximum index for a universal character

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • generateUniversalPartialWords

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> generateUniversalPartialWords(int k,
                                                                                  int n,
                                                                                  int i,
                                                                                  char universalCharacter)
        Generates list of universal partial words with a universal character at the given index with the given alphabet size and code length First calculates the correct length of the u-p-words and then performs a brute force search finding each unique combination of letters in the alphabet of this length. Returns only words that are correct according to DeBruijnWordChecker If
        Parameters:
        k - The size of the alphabet
        n - The code length
        i - The index of the universal character
        universalCharacter - The character used to display the universal character
        Returns:
        ArrayList of found u-p-words

      • generateUniversalPartialWords

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> generateUniversalPartialWords(int k,
                                                                                   int n,
                                                                                   int newLength,
                                                                                   int index,
                                                                                   char universalCharacter)

      • generateUniversalPartialWords

        private static void generateUniversalPartialWords(int k,
                                                  int n,
                                                  int wordLength,
                                                  java.lang.String upword,
                                                  int index,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> covered,
                                                  char universalCharacter,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> found)
        Generates list of universal partial words with a universal character at the given index with the given alphabet size and code length Adds any found u-p-words to a list Recursively extends the given u-p-word for each letter in the given alphabet At each step adds any new code found to covered codes list Ends when either the current u-p-word is of the correct length, adding it to the current list if it is correct OR ends when a code is found that already exists in the covered codes list, indicating that this u-p-word is incorrect
        Parameters:
        k - The alphabet size
        n - The code length
        wordLength - The current depth, indicates when u-p-word is complete
        upword - The u-p-word so far
        index - The index the universal character is to be placed
        covered - List of codes covered so far in this u-p-word
        universalCharacter - The character used to display the universal character
        found - List of u-p-words found so far overall

      • getMaxIndex

        public static int getMaxIndex(int k,
                              int n)
        Calculates the maximum length for a universal partial word with given alphabet size and code length This indicates the maximum index for a universal character
        Parameters:
        k - The alphabet size
        n - The code length
        Returns:
        The length/maximum index
